verses.kjv: In the seventh year of Jehu Jehoash began to reign; and forty years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
verses.web: Jehoash began to reign in the seventh year of Jehu, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
verses.ct: Jehoash became king during the 7th year of Jehu's reign, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 40 years. His mother's name was Zibiah, from Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash did that which was right in the sight of the LORD all his days wherein Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
verses.web: Jehoash did that which was right in LORD’s eyes all his days in which Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that Jehoash did what was right for as long as Jehoiada the priest guided him.

verses.kjv: But the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
verses.web: However the high places were not taken away. The people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places.
verses.ct: Even so, the hilltop shrines were never removed. The people continued to offer sacrifices and burn incense at those high places.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash said to the priests, All the money of the dedicated things that is brought into the house of the LORD, even the money of every one that passeth the account, the money that every man is set at, and all the money that cometh into any man’s heart to bring into the house of the LORD,
verses.web: Jehoash said to the priests, “All the money of the holy things that is brought into LORD’s house, in current money, the money of the people for whom each man is evaluated, and all the money that it comes into any man’s heart to bring into LORD’s house,
verses.ct: Jehoash told the priests, "Collect all the money brought into the house of the LORD — the regular assessment money, the money from personal valuations, and any freewill offerings people choose to bring.

verses.kjv: Let the priests take it to them, every man of his acquaintance: and let them repair the breaches of the house, wheresoever any breach shall be found.
verses.web: let the priests take it to them, each man from his donor; and they shall repair the damage to the house, wherever any damage is found.”
verses.ct: Each priest should collect from his own donors and use it to repair whatever damage is found in the temple."

verses.kjv: But it was so, that in the three and twentieth year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.
verses.web: But it was so, that in the twenty-third year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the damage to the house.
verses.ct: But by the 23rd year of King Jehoash's reign, the priests still hadn't made any repairs to the temple.

verses.kjv: Then king Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest, and the other priests, and said unto them, Why repair ye not the breaches of the house? now therefore receive no more money of your acquaintance, but deliver it for the breaches of the house.
verses.web: Then king Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest, and for the other priests, and said to them, “Why don’t you repair the damage to the house? Now therefore take no more money from your treasurers, but deliver it for repair of the damage to the house.”
verses.ct: So King Jehoash summoned Jehoiada and the other priests and demanded, "Why haven't you repaired the damage to the temple? From now on, stop keeping the money from your donors. Hand it over for the temple repairs."

verses.kjv: And the priests consented to receive no more money of the people, neither to repair the breaches of the house.
verses.web: The priests consented that they should take no more money from the people, and not repair the damage to the house.
verses.ct: The priests agreed — they would no longer collect money from the people, and they would no longer be responsible for the repairs.

verses.kjv: But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one cometh into the house of the LORD: and the priests that kept the door put therein all the money that was brought into the house of the LORD.
verses.web: But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in its lid, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one comes into LORD’s house; and the priests who kept the threshold put all the money that was brought into LORD’s house into it.
verses.ct: Instead, Jehoiada the priest took a chest, drilled a hole in its lid, and placed it beside the altar on the right side as you enter the house of the LORD. The priests who guarded the entrance dropped all the money brought to the LORD's house into this chest.

verses.kjv: And it was so, when they saw that there was much money in the chest, that the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and they put up in bags, and told the money that was found in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: When they saw that there was much money in the chest, the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and they put it in bags and counted the money that was found in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Whenever they saw the chest was full, the king's secretary and the high priest would come, bag up the money, and count everything that had been collected at the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they gave the money, being told, into the hands of them that did the work, that had the oversight of the house of the LORD: and they laid it out to the carpenters and builders, that wrought upon the house of the LORD,
verses.web: They gave the money that was weighed out into the hands of those who did the work, who had the oversight of LORD’s house; and they paid it out to the carpenters and the builders, who worked on LORD’s house,
verses.ct: Then they handed the counted money over to the supervisors in charge of the work on the LORD's house. Those supervisors paid the carpenters and builders working on the temple,

verses.kjv: And to masons, and hewers of stone, and to buy timber and hewed stone to repair the breaches of the house of the LORD, and for all that was laid out for the house to repair it.
verses.web: and to the masons and the stone cutters, and for buying timber and cut stone to repair the damage to LORD’s house, and for all that was laid out for the house to repair it.
verses.ct: as well as the masons and stonecutters. They also used it to buy timber and cut stone — covering every expense needed to repair the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Howbeit there were not made for the house of the LORD bowls of silver, snuffers, basons, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money that was brought into the house of the LORD:
verses.web: But there were not made for LORD’s house cups of silver, snuffers, basins, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money that was brought into LORD’s house;
verses.ct: However, none of the money brought into the LORD's house was used to make silver bowls, wick trimmers, basins, trumpets, or any gold or silver items for the temple.

verses.kjv: But they gave that to the workmen, and repaired therewith the house of the LORD.
verses.web: for they gave that to those who did the work, and repaired LORD’s house with it.
verses.ct: All of it went directly to the workers to repair the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Moreover they reckoned not with the men, into whose hand they delivered the money to be bestowed on workmen: for they dealt faithfully.
verses.web: Moreover they didn’t demand an accounting from the men into whose hand they delivered the money to give to those who did the work; for they dealt faithfully.
verses.ct: No one even required the supervisors to account for the money they received, because they were completely trustworthy.

verses.kjv: The trespass money and sin money was not brought into the house of the LORD: it was the priests’.
verses.web: The money for the trespass offerings, and the money for the sin offerings was not brought into LORD’s house. It was the priests’.
verses.ct: Money from guilt offerings and sin offerings was not put into the LORD's house — that money belonged to the priests.

verses.kjv: Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it: and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.web: Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it; and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Around that time, King Hazael of Syria marched against Gath and captured it. Then he turned his attention toward Jerusalem, determined to attack it.

verses.kjv: And Jehoash king of Judah took all the hallowed things that Jehoshaphat, and Jehoram, and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicated, and his own hallowed things, and all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and in the king’s house, and sent it to Hazael king of Syria: and he went away from Jerusalem.
verses.web: Jehoash king of Judah took all the holy things that Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicated, and his own holy things, and all the gold that was found in the treasures of LORD’s house, and of the king’s house, and sent it to Hazael king of Syria; and he went away from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: King Jehoash of Judah gathered up all the sacred items that his ancestors — Kings Jehoshaphat, Jehoram, and Ahaziah of Judah — had dedicated, along with his own sacred gifts and all the gold found in the treasuries of the LORD's house and the royal palace. He sent everything to Hazael king of Syria, and Hazael withdrew from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Joash's reign and all that he did is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: And his servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and slew Joash in the house of Millo, which goeth down to Silla.
verses.web: His servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and struck Joash at the house of Millo, on the way that goes down to Silla.
verses.ct: His own officials formed a conspiracy against him and assassinated Joash at the house of Millo, on the road going down to Silla.

verses.kjv: For Jozachar the son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, smote him, and he died; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: For Jozacar the son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, struck him, and he died; and they buried him with his fathers in David’s city; and Amaziah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: The assassins were his servants Jozachar son of Shimeath and Jehozabad son of Shomer. After he died, they buried him with his ancestors in the city of David, and his son Amaziah became king in his place.
